race.name: Fast Fitty
race.tagline: Shaded canopy, Lacey Lake views, and fast Michigan farmland gravel near Charlotte.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Michigan countryside. Moderate elevation with rolling scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Local Michigan event. Rolling terrain with good access, low costs, and small local field.

biased_opinion.summary: Fast Fitty is a local event in Michigan‚Äîrolling terrain with moderate elevation. The Michigan countryside is nice and it's good value, but the small local field and limited organization keep it in Tier 4.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid local Michigan gravel race. Worth it for Michigan/Midwest riders. Not worth traveling for.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're local to Michigan‚Äîyes, it's good value. If you're traveling‚Äîskip it.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better Michigan races: Barry-Roubaix, Iceman Cometh.

logistics.lodging_strategy: Charlotte has limited lodging options. Book ahead.
logistics.food: Charlotte has limited dining options. Stock nutrition.

non_negotiables.why: Michigan rolling terrain requires sustained effort.

logistics.explanation: 7:30 AM packet pickup with 10:00 AM start at AL!VE gives reasonable timing, but one rider was "already waffling" Friday night over 50% thunderstorm chances. Eaton County Sheriff's Department marshals major road crossings, volunteers handle others. The staggered start times (Fast Fitty 10:00, Speedy 10:10, Shorty 10:15) create traffic mixing issues by mile 45: "Be aware of traffic from the shorter races now."

length.explanation: 54 miles breaks riders predictably around mile 20: "Consistent climbers would leave me behind and the gaps just kept getting bigger. Around mile 20 I was riding alone." Gimpdiggity bonked at mile 35 in 2020, calling it quits. The distance rewards steady pacing over explosive efforts, with "long, grinding climbs that seem to never end" wearing down undertrained riders systematically. More compact than Grinduro.

technicality.explanation: "Right off the pavement it was pure washboard. I couldn't avoid it. It was high speed, and it sucked," describes the early gravel transition that scattered a 10-rider group. Two pothole incidents around mile 30 happened "in transitions into the shadows" on descents. The 80% gravel surface is mostly smooth rolling roads, but weather turns it into a "mudder" requiring bike handling adjustments rather than true technical skills. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: 2,550 feet over 54 miles creates "long, grinding climbs that seem to never end" rather than punchy ascents. Grades hit 7% before flattening to "3-4% for a while," with rollers building from "2-3%" early to "5 or 6%" by mile 15. A climb around mile 41 reaches 6%, and there's "a kicker" at mile 52. The consistent elevation "keeps creeping" without major suffering. Less climbing than The Mid South.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 81¬∞F and lows of 63¬∞F, with a 47% chance of rain on any given day. Mid-August conditions create heat exposure concerns by mile 15: "if the heat is ramping up you will feel this section." The 2024 race featured "tough conditions with wind, steady rain a little over quarter of the way in" that turned the course into a mudder. Weather gambling is real - riders check forecasts Friday night and waffle over 50% thunderstorm chances affecting race day decisions. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

altitude.explanation: Charlotte, Michigan sits in low-elevation farm country with zero altitude considerations. The terrain is rolling Eaton and Barry county gravel roads through farmland, offering no respiratory challenge or mountain training benefit. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds ‚Äî no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: The course runs "along Lacey Lake with some sections completely shaded by big, mature trees" and passes "Sammy the Satellite dish (he offers you a smile), a fresh produce stand, wonderfully preserved farms/farm houses/barns, and a graffiti-laced rail car." Pleasant rural Michigan scenery through farmland corridors, but predictable gravel roads without exploratory elements or wilderness exposure.

prestige.explanation: Being "the 6th person to sign up" earns you a low number plate that draws confused stares at the start line, but no competitive credibility. Regional Michigan Gravel Race Series event in Charlotte lacks notable winners or pro field data. The charitable focus on human trafficking victim rehabilitation adds meaning but doesn't elevate competitive status beyond weekend warrior racing.

race_quality.explanation: Cash payouts to top 3 men and women show organization, but execution varies with conditions. The 2024 "mudder" created cramping issues, and washboard sections early in the race scatter groups unexpectedly. Course marshaling by Eaton County Sheriff's Department at major crossings provides safety infrastructure, though volunteer-marshaled crossings create consistency questions.

experience.explanation: The course provides steady suffering through "rollers that just continue" with climbs visible ahead on straight roads. Mid-race cooperation opportunities arise: "I had a guy catch me. He moved ahead of me and waved me to follow. We worked together for the next few miles." However, isolation sets in quickly - around mile 20 riders often find themselves alone, making it a test of individual pacing rather than group dynamics.

community.explanation: All proceeds support The House of Promise in Lansing for human trafficking victim rehabilitation, creating purpose beyond racing. Course marshals earn appreciation reminders: "Thank your course Marshall at the intersections as you fly thru." The charity mission and volunteer infrastructure from sheriff's department to intersection marshals demonstrates community investment in both safety and social impact.

field_depth.explanation: Early registration gets you number 6, and drawing that low number creates awkward starting pen moments with riders giving "blank stares." Gimpdiggity's experience of riding "literally solo" for good portions suggests thin competitive depth. Regional Michigan field without notable past winners or competitive times data indicates weekend warrior participation rather than deep racing talent. Thinner field than Ouray Gravel Grinder.

value.explanation: $40 early bird rising to $80 for 54 miles with cash prizes and meaningful charity impact delivers solid return. All proceeds fund human trafficking victim rehabilitation through The House of Promise, giving every entry fee social purpose beyond personal racing goals. Course marshaling by sheriff's department and volunteers adds safety value often missing from budget gravel events.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $50-75. Charlotte, Michigan location keeps accommodation costs reasonable compared to destination gravel towns. 10:00 AM start allows regional riders to drive morning-of, avoiding hotel expenses. Rural Michigan setting means lower meal and lodging costs, though specific pricing data unavailable from the research. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

citations.label: reddit.com: What Are Your 2024 Cycling Goals

2024.conditions: - Historical weather incidents: 2024 race was a mudder; 2025 racer noted health issues but no weather mention
key_takeaways: Historical weather incidents: 2024 race was a mudder; 2025 racer noted health issues but no weather mention

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

videos.title: Fast Fitty Gravel Race 36 Mile Highlights
videos.description:
The Fast Fitty 36 Mile Gravel Race on Aug 19, 2023 in Charlotte, MI.
All post-race proceeds were donated to the House of Promise (Lansing, MI) for human trafficking victim rehabilitation: www.thehouseofpromise.com


Thanks to our sponsor ProForm Bike Shop. If you are in the South Bend, IN area, check them out: www.proformbike.com

Watch the complete Fast Fitty 36 mile race here: https://youtu.be/J6eFZp0IeQg

videos.title: Fast Fitty - 54mi (Gravel Race) 2024
videos.description:
üëâ Hey! SUBSCRIBE for free WATTS üëâ https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsr-SU_SAqjrzmu4kXIRfUQ?sub_confirmation=1

Fast Fitty gravel race was held in Charlotte, MI, and featured some pleasant views and rolling climbs. The course traversed Eaton and Barry counties along Lacey Lake with approximately 85% smooth, but muddy, gravel roads. There were 3 different distances, and I raced the 54 mile as part of the Michigan Gravel Race Series (MGRS) Long category.

The area received some rain the day before and the forecast called for scattered thunderstorms on race day. I was expecting the course to be muddy and was hoping we'd miss the rain, unfortunately we did not. The race stared off with a few attacks and there was a crash at 24:40 that I just barely missed. I believe he either overlapped wheels or thought we were turning left. 

After the crash I felt a bit uneasy about the rest of the race. The rain started around 30 minutes in and it was setting up for a break to get away. There were several solo attacks to attempt to start a breakaway and eventually at around 43:00 the last of 3 individuals was successful. I wasn't positioned to take advantage of the beak and didn't have the legs to attempt a bridge across. For the next hour the group mostly stayed together until another group of 3 got away at 1:42:40. I knew I needed to be in this breakaway, but my legs were done and I couldn't cover the move.

The remaining group was about 11-15 racers and for the last hour no one was interested in catching the breakaway or pulling in the front. There were a few of us willing to work and I tried to create a break but was unsuccessful, so I just waited for the sprint. Luckily, I was able to win the group sprint to take 7th overall and 2nd in my age group. A bit disappointed I couldn't cover the second break but this being my 3rd race in 4 weeks meant I was in desperate need of a recovery week. 

üëâ Hey! SUBSCRIBE for free WATTS üëâ https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCsr-SU_SAqjrzmu4kXIRfUQ?sub_confirmation=1

videos.curation_reason: Complete race experience video with highest view count and detailed description of muddy course conditions.

videos.title: Fast Fitty Gravel Race : Speedy (Front Group)
videos.description:
Fast Fitty Gravel Race in Charlotte, MI is part of the Michigan Gravel Race Series with all proceeds are given to The House of Promise in Lansing, MI.
The race was wet, muddy and a slow grind. The lead group dwindled down to around 15 guys mostly out of attrition because of the heavy wet gravel roads.
videos.curation_reason: Front group perspective showing race dynamics and attrition due to challenging muddy conditions.

race_day_tips.text: Be prepared for potential cramping issues late in the race - one rider experienced severe cramping about three miles from the finish.

additional_quotes.text: I cramped really bad about three miles from the finish. Like Frankenstein walking bad. But walked it out a little bit, got back on the bike and finished.

rider_intel.search_text: The Fast Fitty gravel race takes place in Charlotte, Michigan and offers both 50-mile and 36-mile distance options. According to race participants, cramping can be a significant issue in the final miles of the race, with one rider experiencing severe cramping approximately three miles from the finish line. The race appears to be well-organized with proper podium ceremonies for finishers. Riders note this as a challenging event that requires proper preparation, especially for those who haven't raced recently during the summer season. The race serves as good preparation for other major gravel events later in the season.
